Turing Award 1970

Winner: James H. Wilkinson

Wilkinson's numerical analysis, uses numerical approximation to solve problems in mathematical analysis. Numerical analysis is used extensively in engineering and physics, and today it is also used in the social sciences and medicine. Thanks to the current computing power, it is possible to use numerical analysis in a more complex way, managing to create detailed mathematical models. Through numerical analysis it is possible to calculate ordinary differential equations, celestial mechanics, stochastic differential equations and numerical linear algebra of data analysis. Before modern powerful computer, people used to use hand interpolation formulas, by receiving data from printed tables.
